comments:
On the Mac,
1) open the Run... dialog
2) select any already existing "Java Application" configuration (create one if there are none)
3) push the New button.

This causes the stack trace show below. Notice that it is a "graphic is disposed" error. It appears that 
the reason this is happening is because, one of the images stored in a TabItem has been disposed. The 
reason that this fails on the Mac, but works on (for example) Windows, is because Windows makes a 
copy of the image for use by the Tab, so it doesn't matter if the original is disposed. However, the 
contract is that you should not dispose of the Image as long as it is stored in a tab, so this appears to 
be a problem with the launcher UI code.

===================

CC'ing VI since she helped me debug this.

Fixed. Instead of maintaining a static reference to an image accessed illegally across plug-in 
boundaries, I just copied the image from the JDT UI plugin and added it to the JavaDebugImages 
registry. This removes any problems relating to disposing the image because we don't do it 
anymore (the registry takes care of that).

Please verify changes to JavaDebugImages and JavaClasspathTab, DarinS.
The classpath icon seems pretty messed up in I20040210.
It looked fine on the Mac yesterday and it looks fine on Linux-GTK this morning.
Something funky on Windows...I will look into it.
My mistake. It's messed up on Linux too. I'll fix it. I think the image is bad.
Just waiting to verify on the Mac...it is a shared resource in this land.
Verified the new icon and used the test case on the Mac.
